page.title: 12RECREATION - CHILDREN 2
page.content: In the summer children make full use of the Recreation Ground, play tennis, or may be invited to swim in one of the private pools in local houses. In the winter they watch a lot of "telly" but the majority also play a variety of board games. Chess is quite popular, especially as it is played at school. In the playground the most popular games are those based on catching and chasing,such as It,40-40, and 19-Out. In the latter the catcher is given 20 seconds for catching. About twice a year there is a craze for playing marbles, lasting about six weeks. This is always played between two contestants with the intent of hitting the opponent's marble. There are often bitter disputes as to whether the game is being played for "keeps" or not, i.e. whether the winner may keep the marble struck.
